intro: Clarkia gracilis, commonly known as slender clarkia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Clarkia gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
